headline: HPE Reimagines Hybrid IT Operations With GreenLake Intelligence
summary: LAS VEGAS, June 24, 2025--HPE (NYSE: HPE) today announced a transformational vision for hybrid IT operations with ultimate simplicity through GreenLake Intelligence, a new agentic AI framework for hybrid operations. Through a unified infusion of agentic AIOps across almost every infrastructure layer, HPE is transforming GreenLake cloud into an agentic-AI-powered hybrid cloud.

headline: HPE and Veeam Deepen Strategic Partnership to Deliver Superior Data Resiliency and Recovery
summary: LAS VEGAS, June 24, 2025--HPE Discover 2025 -- HPE (NYSE: HPE) and Veeam® Software, the #1 global leader by market share in data resilience, today announced that the two companies are furthering their long-term, strategic relationship with a new collaboration to offer customers comprehensive data backup and resilience solutions. Veeam Data Platform will integrate with HPE Morpheus VM Essentials Software to give customers a simplified and unified way to protect modern applications and data.

headline: HPE to Power Miami Freedom Park, Provide Ultimate Fan Experience for Inter Miami CF
summary: LAS VEGAS & MIAMI, June 24, 2025--HPE Discover – HPE (NYSE: HPE), Miami Freedom Park, and Inter Miami CF have signed a partnership for HPE to be the first founding partner and an official technology partner for Miami Freedom Park, the new 131-acre mixed-use development, and the exclusive Network Infrastructure, Solutions, and Hybrid Cloud partner of Major League Soccer club Inter Miami CF. headline: TD SYNNEX Recognized as Global 2025 Distributor of the Year by HPE
summary: FREMONT, Calif., & CLEARWATER, Fla., June 24, 2025--TD SYNNEX (NYSE:SNX), a leading global distributor and solutions aggregator for the IT ecosystem, today announced it has received the Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) 2025 Global Distributor of the Year Award. The company was also recognized by HPE as Distributor of the Year in North America and Northern Western Europe, covering France, Belgium, Netherlands, Luxembourg, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland and the Baltics. headline: BlackRock launches Texas ETF as state draws investor interest
summary: The Lone Star State's low taxes, business-friendly policies and growing tech and energy sectors have attracted investors and asset managers looking to tap into its long-term growth potential.  BlackRock said iShares Texas Equity ETF will invest in companies headquartered in the state.  The world's largest asset manager said Texas is home to one in ten publicly traded U.S. companies, and that more than 300 firms have relocated their headquarters to the state since 2015.

headline: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Hewlett Packard Enterprise’s Q1 Earnings Call
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise’s first quarter results reflected a mix of headwinds and operational improvements across its core segments, as management targeted execution issues in its server business and capitalized on expanding demand for AI-driven infrastructure. CEO Antonio Neri highlighted that the company “addressed the operational challenges we experienced in our service segment last quarter,” referencing the implementation of new pricing analytics and increased discount scrutiny.
